verses.text: The Lord created man of the earth, And turned him into it again.
He gave them few days, and a \add short\add* time, And power also over the \add things\add* therein.
He endued them with strength by themselves, And made them according to his image,
And put the fear of man upon all flesh, And gave him dominion over beasts and fowls.
\add They received the use of the five operations of the Lord\add*, And in the sixth place he imparted them understanding, And in the seventh, speech, an interpreter of the cogitations thereof.
Counsel, and a tongue, and eyes, Ears, and a heart, gave he them to understand.
\add Withal\add* he filled them \add with\add* the knowledge of understanding, And shewed them good and evil.
He set his eye upon their hearts, That \add he\add* might shew them the greatness of his works.
He gave \add them\add* to glory in his marvellous acts for ever, That they might declare his works with understanding.
And the elect shall praise his holy name.
Beside \add this\add* he gave them knowledge, And the law of life for an heritage.
He made an everlasting covenant with them, And shewed them his judgments.
Their eyes saw the majesty of \add his\add* glory, And their ears heard his glorious voice.
And he said unto them, Beware of all unrighteousness; And he gave every man commandment concerning \add his\add* neighbour.
Their ways \add are\add* ever before him, \add And\add* shall not be hid from his eyes.
Every man from \add his\add* youth \add is given\add* to evil; Neither could they make to themselves fleshy hearts for stony.
For in the division of the nations of the whole earth He set a ruler over every people; But Israel is the Lordâ€™s portion:
Whom, being \add his\add* firstborn, he nourisheth with discipline, And giving \add him\add* the light of \add his\add* love doth not forsake him.
Therefore all their works \add are\add* as the sun before him, And his eyes \add are\add* continually upon their ways.
None of their unrighteous deeds are hid from him, But all their sins \add are\add* before the Lord
But the Lord being gracious, and knowing his workmanship, Neither left nor forsook them, but spared them.
The alms of a man \add is\add* as a signet with him, And he will keep the good deeds of man as the apple \add of the eye\add*, And give repentance to his sons and daughters.
Afterward he will rise up and reward them, And render their recompence upon their heads.
But unto them that repent, he granted \add them\add* return, And comforted those that fail \add in\add* patience.
Return unto the Lord, and forsake \add thy\add* sins, Make thy prayer before \add his\add* face, and offend less.
Turn again to the most High, and turn away from iniquity: For he will lead \add thee\add* out of darkness into the light of health, And hate thou abomination vehemently.
Who shall praise the most High in the grave, Instead of them which live and give thanks?
Thanksgiving perisheth from the dead, as \add from\add* one that is not: The living and sound in heart shall praise the Lord.
How great \add is\add* the lovingkindness of the Lord our God, And \add his\add* compassion unto such as turn unto him in holiness!
For all \add things\add* cannot be in men, Because the son of man \add is\add* not immortal.
What \add is\add* brighter than the sun? yet the light thereof faileth: And flesh and blood will imagine evil.
He vieweth the power of the height of heaven; And all men \add are but\add* earth and ashes.
